bikes.name: Apache RR 310
bikes.take: The TVS Apache RR 310 is a fully faired sports bike built in collaboration with BMW. The latest version comes with an upgraded 38 bhp engine and 29 Nm torque, making it more powerful and track-ready. It also features multiple riding modes, a TFT display, and a premium aerodynamic design.
goodThings: Upgraded 38 bhp engine with better performance

reviews.comment: Absolutely love the performance and handling. The TFT console is very informative.
Great bike for highways and city rides. Could use a smoother gearbox.
Feels premium and well-built. A worthy alternative to the KTM RC 390.

bikes.name: G310 RR
bikes.take: The BMW G310RR is a lightweight sports bike that shares its platform with the TVS Apache RR 310. It features a 312.2 cc liquid-cooled engine producing 34 bhp and 28 Nm torque. With sharp styling, a TFT console, and multiple riding modes, it is an appealing option for beginner and experienced riders alike.

reviews.comment: Smooth ride and great handling. Definitely worth the premium pricing.
Very stable and confidence-inspiring on highways. Gear shifts could be better.
Love the looks and performance. A solid entry-level sports bike.

bikes.name: Classic 350
bikes.take: The Classic 350 offers a blend of vintage charm and modern refinement. It is a comfortable and easy-to-ride motorcycle with good low-end torque. However, the weight can be a concern for some riders.
bikes.rearSuspension: Twin shock absorbers with adjustable preload
goodThings: Classic design appeals to vintage lovers
badThings: Lacks modern features like Bluetooth connectivity

reviews.comment: I love the vintage look and feel. The bike is very smooth, but I wish it was a bit lighter.
I love the vintage look and feel. The bike is very smooth, but I wish it was a bit lighter.
I love the vintage look and feel. The bike is very smooth, but I wish it was a bit lighter.

bikes.name: Himalayan 450
bikes.take: The Himalayan 450 is a great adventure touring motorcycle with excellent off-road capabilities. The power is adequate for long journeys, but the bike feels a bit heavy in slow-moving traffic.
goodThings: High ground clearance for rough terrains
badThings: Heavy weight makes it tough in traffic
Not the most powerful in the segment

reviews.comment: An amazing bike for adventure rides. Feels very comfortable on long trips and the suspension is top-notch.
An amazing bike for adventure rides. Feels very comfortable on long trips and the suspension is top-notch.
An amazing bike for adventure rides. Feels very comfortable on long trips and the suspension is top-notch.

bikes.name: S 1000 RR
bikes.take: The BMW S 1000 RR is a high-performance sportbike featuring advanced aerodynamics, cutting-edge electronics, and a powerful inline-four engine. It is designed for both road and track use, offering precision handling and thrilling speed.
badThings: Aggressive riding posture not comfortable for long rides

reviews.comment: This bike is an absolute beast on the road. The power delivery is insane, and the quickshifter makes it a dream to ride on the track. Worth every penny!
The S 1000 RR is the best superbike I've ever owned. However, the aggressive riding position can be tiring for long rides. Ideal for thrill-seekers!
The best track bike in its class. Smooth handling, precise control, and stunning design. BMW has nailed it with this machine!

bikes.name: Street 750
bikes.take: The Street 750 is a powerful yet accessible cruiser, offering a comfortable ride with a liquid-cooled V-twin engine. Ideal for city riding and long highways.
goodThings: Premium Harley feel at an entry-level price

reviews.comment: Super comfortable for long rides. The engine is smooth, and the torque is perfect for highway cruising. Feels premium!
Great entry-level Harley. The weight is slightly on the heavier side, but once moving, it's very stable and confidence-inspiring.
Perfect cruiser for a beginner Harley rider. The engine refinement is great, but I wish it had a little more power.

bikes.name: Duke 390
bikes.take: The KTM Duke 390 is a lightweight, aggressive streetfighter known for its sharp handling, quick acceleration, and premium features like a TFT display and ride-by-wire throttle.
badThings: Firm suspension may feel harsh on bad roads
Low mileage compared to other 300cc bikes
Slightly aggressive riding posture for long rides

reviews.comment: Incredible acceleration and handling! The quickshifter makes shifting effortless, and the TFT display is super informative.
Great bike for aggressive riders. Suspension is stiff, but it gives amazing feedback in corners. Perfect for track days!
Absolutely love the styling and tech features. Could have better pillion comfort, but for solo riders, it's a beast!

bikes.name: Aerox 155
bikes.take: Yamaha Aerox 155 is a high-performance scooter with a 155cc liquid-cooled engine, sharp sporty design, and connected features like Bluetooth connectivity.
goodThings: Modern digital instrument console with Bluetooth connectivity
Sporty design and comfortable riding position
badThings: Small fuel tank capacity of only 5.5 liters
Lacks traction control and dual-channel ABS
Slightly expensive for a scooter in its segment

reviews.comment: Amazing performance for a scooter! Feels powerful and handles well in city traffic. The Bluetooth connectivity is a plus.
Good for daily rides, but the small fuel tank means frequent refills. Looks stylish and feels premium.
Very smooth ride, and I love the digital console. The under-seat storage is big enough for a full-face helmet.

bikes.name: Ninja ZX-10R
bikes.take: The Kawasaki Ninja ZX-10R is currently one of the most affordable litre-class supersport motorcycles in the market. It offers a potent and refined engine along with good braking hardware. Nevertheless, being track-focused, the ZX-10R isn't a very city-friendly motorcycle and is also high on maintenance.
bikes.frontSuspension: 43mm USD Forks with Compression, Rebound & Preload Adjust
bikes.rearSuspension: Horizontal Back-link with BFRC lite gas-charged shock, fully adjustable
goodThings: One of the most affordable superbikes in the country
badThings: Riding position is aggressive for city use
Limited service network compared to rivals

reviews.comment: An absolute beast! The performance, handling, and braking are top-notch. It's a dream machine for track lovers.
Fantastic superbike for the price, but maintenance costs are on the higher side. Not the best for city rides, but unbeatable on highways!
Kawasaki nailed the aerodynamics and power delivery. Quickshifter is smooth, and the traction control is a lifesaver.

bikes.name: S1 Pro
bikes.take: The Ola S1 Pro is one of the best electric scooters in India, offering great ridingRange, high-tech features, and smooth acceleration.
goodThings: Long battery life and impressive ridingRange
High-tech features like touchscreen display and GPS

reviews.comment: An absolute beast! The performance, handling, and braking are top-notch. It's a dream machine for track lovers.
An absolute beast! The performance, handling, and braking are top-notch. It's a dream machine for track lovers.

bikes.name: Splendor Plus
bikes.take: The Hero Splendor Plus is India's most popular commuter motorcycle, known for its excellent mileage, reliability, and low maintenance costs. It is a great choice for daily commuting with a comfortable riding posture and fuel efficiency.
bikes.rearSuspension: Swingarm with 5-Step Adjustable Hydraulic Shock Absorbers
badThings: Basic design with no modern features
Suspension could be better for bad roads

reviews.comment: Great bike for daily commuting. Mileage is impressive, and it's very easy to ride in traffic.
Affordable and reliable, but could have had a digital display and better headlight performance.
Runs like a charm with low maintenance. A perfect bike for city rides and long-term use.

bikes.name: Meteor 350
bikes.take: The Royal Enfield Meteor 350 is a classic cruiser that offers a smooth riding experience, relaxed ergonomics, and modern technology with Tripper Navigation.
bikes.rearSuspension: Twin shock absorbers with adjustable preload

reviews.comment: Great highway comfort and smooth engine performance.
Handles well, but I wish it had more power.
A true cruiser experience with a modern touch.

bikes.name: R 1250 RT
bikes.take: The BMW R 1250 RT is a luxury touring motorcycle known for its powerful ShiftCam boxer engine, aerodynamic fairing, and advanced riding aids.

reviews.comment: The most comfortable and feature-loaded touring bike I've ever ridden!
Handles well and is extremely stable at high speeds.
Perfect for long-distance touring, but quite expensive.

bikes.name: Honda Gold Wing Tour
bikes.take: The Honda Gold Wing is the ultimate luxury touring motorcycle, featuring a powerful 1,833cc engine, premium comfort, and advanced technology for long-distance touring.
bikes.instrumentConsole: 7-inch TFT Display with Apple CarPlay & Android Auto
goodThings: Advanced tech with Apple CarPlay & Android Auto
badThings: One of the most expensive touring bikes

reviews.comment: Nothing beats the comfort of a Gold Wing! Best bike for long-distance rides.
Luxury on two wheels! The tech and ride quality are unmatched.
Absolutely love the comfort and smoothness of the ride.

bikes.name: Shine
bikes.take: The Honda Shine is a reliable and fuel-efficient commuter motorcycle known for its smooth performance, refined engine, and excellent mileage.

reviews.comment: Best commuter bike in this segment, very smooth engine and great mileage.
Affordable and reliable, but lacks modern features like digital console.
Good for daily commute, comfortable and fuel-efficient.

bikes.name: Speed 400
bikes.take: The Triumph Speed 400 is a lightweight, performance-oriented modern classic that blends retro design with cutting-edge technology and a torquey engine.
goodThings: Great value for money in the modern classic segment
badThings: Slightly firm suspension for city rides

reviews.comment: Best modern classic under 3 lakhs! Feels premium and refined.
The engine and handling are top-notch, but the suspension is a bit stiff.
Fantastic bike with Triumphs heritage. Best in its class!

bikes.name: Ninja H2R
bikes.take: The Kawasaki Ninja H2R is a track-focused hyperbike with immense power and advanced aerodynamics. It is the pinnacle of performance engineering, with a supercharged engine and lightweight frame designed for extreme speed and agility.

reviews.comment: The Kawasaki Ninja H2R is a beast! Its a dream machine for any track enthusiast. Pure adrenaline rush!
I cant believe the speed and power of this bike. Its an engineering marvel. A must-have for extreme performance lovers.
Incredible machine, but the price and maintenance make it a difficult choice for many riders.

bikes.name: F77 SuperStreet
bikes.take: The Ultraviolette F77 SuperStreet is a cutting-edge electric motorcycle known for its powerful performance, high speed, and futuristic design.
goodThings: Exceptional ridingRange for an electric motorcycle
Advanced safety features like traction control

reviews.comment: Amazing ride! The speed and torque are unbelievable. Definitely worth the price if you're looking for top-tier performance.

bikes.name: NS 400z
bikes.take: The Pulsar NS400 is Bajaj's biggest Pulsar ever which is equipped with the engine that also powers the Dominar 400. This motorcycle gets a good feature list and with such an aggressive pricing, the NS400Z is definitely going to find a lot of takers.
badThings: Looks like its smaller sibling Pulsar NS200
Misses out on the more modern 400cc engine

bikes.name: Jupiter
bikes.take: The new Jupiter 110 is a family scooter designed for a much younger audience. It gets new engine, lots of new features and has styling that will attract a lot of new buyers.
